jam.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a thick sweet substance made from boiled fruit and sugar, eaten especially on bread
jam.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a situation in which it is difficult or impossible to move because there are so many cars or people
jam.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Sorry weâ€™re late. We got stuck in a traffic jam.
jam.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a situation in which a machine does not work because something is stopping a part from moving
jam.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: It caused a jam in the printer.
jam.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: We became friends after he helped me out of a jam.
jam.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a song or piece of music, especially one by a rap or rock group
jam.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to push something somewhere using a lot of force, until it can move no further
jam.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: He jammed his foot on the accelerator and the car sped off.
A chair had been jammed up against the door.
jam.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: if a moving part of something jams, or if you jam it, it no longer works properly because something is preventing it from moving
jam.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The front roller has jammed on the photocopier.
jam.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: if a lot of people or vehicles jam a place, they fill it so that it is difficult to move
jam.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: Crowds jammed the entrance to the stadium.
They all jammed into the car.
jam.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: to play music in an informal way with other people
jam.translation[1].definitions[4].defini: to deliberately prevent broadcasts or other electronic signals from being received, by broadcasting signals on the same wavelength
